element.name: Primary Method of Payment
element.definition: The primary method of payment or type of insurance associated with this EMS encounter

element.name: Physician Certification Statement
element.definition: Indication of whether a physician certification statement (PCS) is available documenting the medical necessity or the EMS encounter.
element.v3Comment:
Data Element Name changed from Certificate of Medical Necessity to Physician Certification Statement. The PCS statement and documentation of medical necessity is a requirement of the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services. The circumstances are defined in 42 CFR 410.40 (d)(2) and (d)(3). http://www.cms.gov/
A PCS is required for the following non-emergency transport:
1) Non-Emergency Repetitive Scheduled
2) Non Emergency Non-Repetitive-Scheduled
3) Non Emergency Services - Non Scheduled - Under direct care of a physician

element.name: Date Physician Certification Statement Signed
element.definition: The date the Physician Certification Statement was signed
element.v3Comment:
Added to assist in billing documentation. Associated with ePayment.02: Physician Certification Statement.
DateTime consists of finite-length characters of the form: yyyy '-' mm '-' dd 'T' hh ':' mm ':' ss ('.' s+)? (zzzzzz)
yyyya four-digit numeral that represents the year
'-'separators between parts of the date portion
mma two-digit numeral that represents the month
dda two-digit numeral that represents the day
Tseparator that indicates time-of-day follows
hha two-digit numeral that represents the hour
':'a separator between parts of the time-of-day portion
mma two-digit numeral that represents the minute
ssa two-integer-digit numeral that represents the whole seconds
'.' s+(not required) represents the fractional seconds
zzzzzz(required) represents the timezone (as described below)
Timezones, required, are durations with (integer-valued) hour and minute properties in the form: ('+' | '-') hh ':' mm
hha two-digit numeral (with leading zeros as required) that represents the hours
mma two-digit numeral that represents the minutes
'+'a nonnegative duration
'-'a nonpositive duration

element.name: Reason for Physician Certification Statement
element.definition: The reason for EMS transport noted on the Physician Certification Statement
element.v3Comment: Added to assist in billing documentation.

choice.description: Danger to self or others-seclusion (flight risk)
DVT requires elevation of lower extremity
Moderate to severe pain on movement
Morbid Obesity requires additional personnel/equipment to handle
Orthopedic device (backboard, halo, use of pins in traction, etc) requiring special handling in transit
Restraints (Physical or Chemical) anticipated or used during transport
Risk of falling off wheelchair or stretcher while in motion (not related to obesity)
Severe Muscular weakness and de-conditioned state precludes any significant physical activity
Third Party assistance/attendant required to apply, administer, or regulate or adjust oxygen en route
Unable to maintain erect sitting position in a chair for time needed to transport, due to moderate muscular weakness and de-conditioning.
Unable to sit in chair or wheelchair due to Grade II or greater decubitus ulcers on buttocks.

element.name: Healthcare Provider Type Signing Physician Certification Statement
element.definition: The type of healthcare provider who signed the Physician Certification Statement

element.name: Last Name of Individual Signing Physician Certification Statement
element.definition: The last name of the healthcare provider who signed the Physician Certification Statement.
element.v3Comment: Added to assist in billing documentation.

element.name: First Name of Individual Signing Physician Certification Statement
element.definition: The first name of the healthcare provider who signed the Physician Certification Statement.
element.v3Comment: Added to assist in billing documentation.

element.name: Patient Resides in Service Area
element.definition: An indication of whether the patient's current residence is within the EMS agency service area.
element.v3Comment: Added to assist in billing documentation.

choice.description: Not a Resident Within EMS Service Area

element.name: Insurance Company ID
element.definition: The ID Number of the patient's insurance company.

element.name: Insurance Company Name
element.definition: The name of the patient's insurance company.

element.name: Insurance Company Billing Priority
element.definition: The billing priority or order for the insurance company.

element.name: Insurance Company Address
element.definition: The mailing address of the Insurance Company

element.name: Insurance Company City
element.definition: The insurance company's city or township
element.v3Comment:
Based on GNIS Civil Code or Populated Place code.
GNIS Codes Website: http://geonames.usgs.gov/domestic/download_data.htm

element.name: Insurance Company State
element.definition: The insurance company's state, territory, or province, or District of Columbia.
element.v3Comment:
Based on the ANSI State Code.
GNIS Codes Website: http://geonames.usgs.gov/domestic/download_data.htm

element.name: Insurance Company ZIP Code
element.definition: The insurance company's ZIP Code
element.v3Comment:
ZIP Codes Product Website: https://www.zipcodedownload.com/Products/Product/Z5Commercial/Standard/Overview/
Product: USA - 5-digit ZIP Code Database, Commercial Edition

element.name: Insurance Company Country
element.definition: The insurance company's country
element.v3Comment:
Based on the ISO Country Code.
ANSI Country Codes (ISO 3166) Website: http://www.iso.org/iso/country_codes/iso_3166_code_lists.htm
element.v3Changes: Added to better document international addresses.

element.name: Insurance Group ID/Name
element.definition: The ID number or name of the patient's insurance group

element.name: Insurance Policy ID Number
element.definition: The ID number of the patient's insurance policy

element.name: Last Name of the Insured
element.definition: The last (family) name of the person insured by the insurance company.

element.name: First Name of the Insured
element.definition: The first (given) name of the person insured by the insurance company

element.name: Middle Initial/Name of the Insured
element.definition: The middle name, if any, of the person insured by the insurance company.

element.name: Relationship to the Insured
element.definition: The relationship of the patient to the primary insured person

element.name: Closest Relative/Guardian Last Name
element.definition: The last (family) name of the patient's closest relative or guardian

element.name: Closest Relative/ Guardian First Name
element.definition: The first (given) name of the patient's closest relative or guardian

element.name: Closest Relative/ Guardian Middle Initial/Name
element.definition: The middle name/initial, if any, of the closest patient's relative or guardian.

element.name: Closest Relative/ Guardian Street Address
element.definition: The home street address of the patient's closest relative or guardian.

element.name: Closest Relative/ Guardian City
element.definition: The home city of the patient's closest relative or guardian.
element.v3Comment:
Based on GNIS Civil Code or Populated Place code.
GNIS Codes Website: http://geonames.usgs.gov/domestic/download_data.htm

element.name: Closest Relative/ Guardian State
element.definition: The home state of the patient's closest relative or guardian
element.v3Comment:
Based on ANSI State Code.
GNIS Codes Website: http://geonames.usgs.gov/domestic/download_data.htm

element.name: Closest Relative/ Guardian ZIP Code
element.definition: The home ZIP Code of the patient's closest relative or guardian
element.v3Comment:
ZIP Codes Product Website: https://www.zipcodedownload.com/Products/Product/Z5Commercial/Standard/Overview/
Product: USA - 5-digit ZIP Code Database, Commercial Edition

element.name: Closest Relative/ Guardian Country
element.definition: The home country of the patient's closest relative or guardian
element.v3Comment:
Based on the ISO Country Code.
ANSI Country Codes (ISO 3166) Website: http://www.iso.org/iso/country_codes/iso_3166_code_lists.htm

element.name: Closest Relative/ Guardian Phone Number
element.definition: The phone number of the patient's closest relative or guardian

element.name: Closest Relative/ Guardian Relationship
element.definition: The relationship of the patient's closest relative or guardian

element.name: Patient's Employer
element.definition: The patient's employers Name

element.name: Patient's Employer's Address
element.definition: The street address of the patient's employer

element.name: Patient's Employer's City
element.definition: The city of the patient's employer
element.v3Comment:
Based on GNIS Civil Code or Populated Place Code.
GNIS Codes Website: http://geonames.usgs.gov/domestic/download_data.htm

element.name: Patient's Employer's State
element.definition: The state of the patient's employer
element.v3Comment:
Based on ANSI State Code.
GNIS Codes Website: http://geonames.usgs.gov/domestic/download_data.htm

element.name: Patient's Employer's ZIP Code
element.definition: The ZIP Code of the patient's employer
element.v3Comment:
ZIP Codes Product Website: https://www.zipcodedownload.com/Products/Product/Z5Commercial/Standard/Overview/
Product: USA - 5-digit ZIP Code Database, Commercial Edition

element.name: Patient's Employer's Country
element.definition: The country of the patient's employer
element.v3Comment:
Based on the ISO Country Code.
ANSI Country Codes (ISO 3166) Website: http://www.iso.org/iso/country_codes/iso_3166_code_lists.htm

element.name: Patient’s Employer’s Primary Phone Number
element.definition: The employer’s primary phone number.

element.name: Response Urgency
element.definition: The urgency in which the EMS agency began to mobilize resources for this EMS encounter.
element.v3Comment: This is for billing documentation.

element.name: Patient Transport Assessment
element.definition: Documentation of the patient's transport need based on mobility and/or physical capability.
element.v3Comment: Added to better justify the medical necessity of the transport. Based on CMS 42 CFR Ch IV (10-1-02 Edition) & 410.40 (d) medical necessity requirement (1)

element.name: Specialty Care Transport Care Provider
element.definition: Documentation to show the patient care provided to the patient met the Specialty Care Transport Base Rate requirements.
element.v3Comment: Added to improve Specialty Care Transport billing justification. In accordance with CMS requirements Specialty Care Transport (SCT): ""Additional training" means the specific additional training that a State requires a paramedic to complete in order to qualify to furnish specialty care to a critically ill or injured patient during an SCT."

element.name: Ambulance Transport Code
element.definition: Indicator about the type of transport of the patient.
element.v3Comment: Added to improve billing with electronic claims using X12. The Ambulance Transport Code values are those determined by US Dept of HHS for the "Code indicating the type of ambulance transport". The Accredited Standards Committee X12 organization maintains the standard. See the X12 website http://www.x12.org or United States Health Information Knowledgebase website for more information: http://ushik.org/dr.ui.drData_Page?system=mdr&Search=xxKEYIDxx&KeyOrgID=18&KeyRID=24821000&Referer=DataElement

element.name: Ambulance Transport Reason Code
element.definition: The CMS Ambulance Transport Reason Code for the transport.
element.v3Comment: Added to improve billing with electronic claims using the ASC X12 Standard. The Ambulance Transport Code values are those determined by US Dept of HHS for the "Code indicating the type of ambulance transport". The Accredited Standards Committee X12 organization maintains the standard. See the X12 website http://www.x12.org or United States Health Information Knowledgebase website for more information: http://ushik.ahrq.gov/ViewItemDetails?system=mdr&itemKey=21826000

choice.description: Patient was transported to the nearest facility for care of symptoms, complaints, or both
Patient was transported for the benefit of a preferred physician
Patient was transported for the nearness of family members
Patient was transported for the care of a specialist or for availability of equipment
Patient was transferred to a Rehabilitation Facility

element.name: Round Trip Purpose Description
element.definition: Free text description providing the purpose of the round trip EMS transport based on CR109 field for CMS.
element.v3Comment:
Added to improve billing documentation for CMS X12 based transactions.
This element should be documented when ePayment.44 (Ambulance Transport) code = X (Round Trip).
Ambulance providers can use this field to provide additional information regarding the circumstances of a round trip transport or for other medical necessity documentation.
element.v3Changes: Added to improve billing with electronic claims using X12

element.name: Stretcher Purpose Description
element.definition: Free Text Documentation providing the reason for use of a stretcher in the EMS patient transport.
element.v3Comment: Added to improve billing using CMS X12 transactions based on CR110. Ambulance providers can use this field to provide additional information regarding the patient's condition that warranted the use of a stretcher or for other medical necessity documentation.
element.v3Changes: Added to improve billing with electronic claims using X12

element.name: Ambulance Conditions Indicator
element.definition: Documentation of the CRC03 through CRC07 requirements for CMS billing using X12 transactions.
element.v3Comment: Added to improve billing documentation and justification.
element.v3Changes: Added to improve billing with electronic claims using X12

choice.description: Patient was bed confined before the ambulance service
Patient was bed confined after the ambulance service
Patient was unconscious or in shock
Patient was transported in an emergency situation
Patient had to be physically restrained
Transportation was to the nearest facility

element.name: Mileage to Closest Hospital Facility
element.definition: The mileage to the closest hospital facility from the scene. Documented only if the patient was transported to a facility farther away than the closest hospital.
element.v3Comment: Added to clarify billing mileage when the patient is not taken to the closest facility.

element.name: ALS Assessment Performed and Warranted
element.definition: Documentation that the patient required an ALS assessment and it was performed.
element.v3Comment: Added to improve billing justification

element.name: CMS Service Level
element.definition: The CMS service level for this EMS encounter.

element.name: EMS Condition Code
element.definition: The condition code associated with the CMS EMS negotiated rule-making process.
element.v3Comment:
Code list is represented in ICD-10-CM Codes:
Website - http://uts.nlm.nih.gov
Product - UMLS Metathesaurus

element.name: CMS Transportation Indicator
element.definition: The CMS Ambulance Fee Schedule Transportation and Air Medical Transportation Indicators are used to better describe why it was necessary for the patient to be transported in a particular way or circumstance.
element.v3Comment: Name changed from Condition Code Modifier to CMS Transportation Indicator
element.v3Changes: Name changed from Condition Code Modifier to CMS Transportation Indicator

choice.description: Interfacility Transport (Requires Higher level of care)
Emergency Trauma Dispatch Condition Code (Major Incident or Mechanism of Injury)
Medically Necessary Transport (Facility on Divert or Services Unavailable)
BLS Transport of ALS Patient (ALS not available)
ALS Response (Based on Dispatch Info) to BLS Patient (Condition)
Long Distance-patient's condition requires rapid transportation over a long distance
Rare Circumstances, Traffic Patterns Precludes Ground Transport
Time to the closest appropriate hospital due to the patient's condition precludes ground transport; maximize clinical benefits
Pick up Point not Accessible by Ground Transport

element.name: Transport Authorization Code
element.definition: Prior authorization code provided by the insurance carrier/payer.

element.name: Prior Authorization Code Payer
element.definition: The Payer who has provided the Prior Authorization Code.
element.v3Comment: Added to document Prior Authorization Codes for an EMS Transport.

element.name: Supply Item Used Name
element.definition: The name of the supply used on the patient by the EMS Crew during the EMS event.
element.v3Comment: Added to track EMS supplies for billing. The list of supplies would be created by the EMS Agency. There is no master list of supply items defined.
element.v3Changes: Added to track EMS supplies for billing.

element.name: Number of Supply Item(s) Used
element.definition: The number of the specific supply item used on the patient by the EMS Crew during the EMS event.
element.v3Comment: Associated with ePayment.56 (Supply Item Used Name). Used to better track supply items for billing
element.v3Changes: Added to track EMS supplies for billing.
